availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 57th Regiment 1861-1864 Commissions and Resignations

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, July 27 1864.
The resignation of the following named Officer is accepted to take effect from this date.

By command of the Governor:
John Boyle
Adjutant General of Kentucky.

Genl D W. Lindsey
Insp Genl.

Adjt Genls Office
July 27th 1864
Special Order No. 53
The resignation of following named officer accepted, take effect date
McCampell A. Col
57th Regt E. M.
Recorded
Recd I. G. O July 28th 1864
